Take Off Ensure it is safe to take off. Aircraft will climb to %s and hover.
Slide to Take-off Return Home and Land Dynamic Home Point Range Home Point will be set to follow the remote controller, updating automatically as you move.
Cancel Return-to-Home Cancel Return-to-Home Land Aircraft Now? Aircraft will land at its current location. Check landing area is clear.
Return-to-Home Confirm to Land Aircraft has landed to 0.3m (1.0ft). Continue landing?
Slide to Return Home (Current height will not be recorded) Aircraft will adjust it\'s nose direction to face the home point, and it\'s altitude to %1$d meters. Current aircraft altitude is %2$.1f meters. Press Return to Home button directly on your remote to cancel this procedure, or take over control sticks.
Aircraft will land at its current location because its distance to Home Point is less that 20m (65.5 ft).
Landed Landing Failed Take-off Completed Take-off Failed Return-to-Home Completed Return-to-Home Failed Return-to-Home Cancelled Cancel Return-to-Home Failed Landing Cancelled Cancel Landing Failed Your current position is far away from the Home Point. Are you sure to return?
Tap to Cancel Return-to-Home Tap to Cancel Landing Aircraft will land at its current location. Check landing area is clear.
Select Return Position Current Position Original Home Point Your current position is far away from the original Home Point. Select a position the aircraft will return to, or click Cancel to exit.
Cannot locate aircraft\'s position in the current environment. Ensure that it is safe to takeoff. The aircraft will fly to an elevation of %s and hover.

Calibrate the compass now. Ensure no magnets or metal objects are near the compass. Compass Calibration Complete Compass Calibration Failed Cancel Calibration Step 1: Ensure no magnets or metal objects are near the compass, from the ground 1.5m(4.9ft). Unfold aircraft arms as indicated
Step 2: Ensure no magnets or metal objects are near the compass, from the ground 1.5m(4.9ft). Rotate aircraft 360 degrees horizontally Face the nose down, then rotate aircraft 360 degrees again Intensive electromagnetic interference nearby. Ensure no magnets or metal objects are near the compass and keep the aircraft 1 meter off the ground to do recalibration.

FlyZone ID not identified. Unlock Unlock %1$s By tapping Unlock, you agree that you have the authorization to operate in this fly zone. A record of this request will be linked to your DJI account. Tap Cancel to abort the operation. Currently unlocked and expires at %1$s Failed to unlock. You are not authorized to unlock this zone. Failed to login. You are not authorized to perform this action. Something went wrong. Failed to login. Please try again later. Warning Enhanced warning Authorized Restricted Self Unlock Custom Unlock In order to unlock fly zones you must login with your DJI account. Tap Log in to continue logging in Custom Unlock on Aircraft Custom Unlock Enabled Failed to perform this action. You are not authorized. Are you sure you want to enable this FlyZone? %1$s is currently enabled. Do you wish you disable it and enable %2$s Enabling custom unlock zone failed. Disabling custom unlock zone failed. In order to retrieve custom unlock fly zones you must login with your DJI account. Please make sure the serial number of the aircraft you are connected to matches your custom unlock records. Access Locker Set Password Enter Password Confirm Password Change Password Enter Current Password Enter New Password Confirm New Password Passwords can contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
Enter Password The password is stored locally on the aircraft. Password retrieval is not available for this reason. DJI is not able to reset your password. If you forget your password, you will need to format the aircraft to remove the password. Formatting the aircraft will delete all data in its storage.
Format Aircraft Format Unlock Remove Password Enter Password To Remove Remove Change or Remove Password The current password is required in order to change or remove the password
This will remove the password and leave the aircraft unsecured. Field cannot be empty Passwords do not match Password set successfully Setting password failed: %1$s. Please try again. Your password is used to ensure the secure use of your aircraft. After setting a password, it will be required to control the aircraft and for reading aircraft memory when the aircraft is connected to a computer as an external device. Passwords can contain uppercase and lowercase letters and numbers.
Aircraft unlocked successfully Aircraft formatted successfully Format aircraft failed: %1$s. Formatting the aircraft will delete all data in its storage. Are you sure you want to format the aircraft?
Password removed successfully Remove password failed: %1$s. Please try again. Password changed successfully Change password failed: %1$s. Please try again. Another aircraft is nearby. Fly with caution. Another aircraft is too close, please descend to a safer altitude. Another aircraft is dangerously close, please descend to a safer altitude.
